question: The main water line into a tall building has a pressure of 600 kPa at 5 m below ground level, as shown in<image 1>. A pump brings the pressure up so thatnthe water can be delivered at 200 kPa at the top floor 100 m above ground level. Assume a flow rate of 10 kg/s liquid water at 10°C and neglect any difference in kinetic energy and internal energy u. Find the pump work.
description: The image depicts a tall building with a water supply system. The water main is located 5 meters below ground level, and it supplies water to the building. A pump is used to increase the pressure of the water so that it can reach the top floor of the building, which is 150 meters above ground level. The water main has a pressure of 600 kPa at the point where it enters the building. The pump is required to deliver water at a pressure of 200 kPa at the top floor, which is 100 meters above ground level. The flow rate of the liquid water is given as 10 kg/s at a temperature of 10°C. The problem assumes that there is no significant difference in kinetic energy or internal energy (u) between the water at the bottom and the top of the building.
